newsitem.title: USA: Ross Systems signs deals, sees improvement.
newsitem.headline: Ross Systems signs deals, sees improvement.

text.p: Ross Systems Inc said Tuesday it had reached new international agreements worth a total of $500,000 and expects further improvements in this area as a result of a recent restructuring.
The agreements are to supply business software for Spain-based fish processor Congelados Galicia SA and beverage manufacturer Las Casera.
Ross also said it had expanded agreements with Mohawk Oil Canada Ltd and Poland-based Kuzniczf.
Ross was downgraded to hold from buy in April by one analyst after reporting a third-quarter loss per share of $0.05, compared to a profit of $0.05 a year earlier.
Ross Chairman and Chief Executive Dennis Vohs said in a statement that the company's international business was doing better.
"We believe the restructuring that we have completed in this area will continue to improve our operations," he said.
Ross shares were up 1/16 to 3-7/16 in early trading.
